summary: This document is a chain of emails from August 2019 between SDNY prosecutors and victim assistance staff coordinating the notification of victims in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails discuss updating victim contact lists in the Victim Notification System (VNS), correcting errors, adding new victims, and finalizing notification letters to be sent out ahead of a court conference.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: An attorney representing multiple victims in the Epstein case. Correspondence indicates notification letters for his clients should be sent to his law office.

persons.name: Daniel J. Rose
persons.context: An attorney representing a victim. Correspondence specifies that letters for his client should be sent to his law firm, Daniel J. Rose, P.A.

events.title: Finalization of victim notification letters
events.description: Prosecutors and staff coordinate to finalize and send out notification letters to identified victims, discussing which victims have contact info and which have opted out.

events.title: Coordination call on victim list discrepancies
events.description: SDNY victim assistance staff and a case agent schedule a call to reconcile discrepancies between different versions of the victim list in the Victim Notification System (VNS).

keyFacts: The SDNY was actively managing a Victim Notification System (VNS) with a list of victims in the Epstein case in July-August 2019.
The correspondence reveals challenges in maintaining an accurate victim list, including typos, incorrect attorney assignments, and missing contact information.
A specific victim is noted as having 'opted out of notifications,' indicating some victims chose not to be contacted by the prosecution.
The urgency of sending notifications was tied to an upcoming court conference.
Multiple email participants are redacted, indicating coordination between SDNY prosecutors, victim assistance staff, and FBI case agents.
